intro: Oxygraphis palmata, commonly known as the yellow palm, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa and Asia. It is a member of the Arecaceae family, which includes palms, and is characterized by its slender, unbranched stem and large, pinnately compound leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, followed by small, round fruits. Oxygraphis palmata is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and relatively low maintenance requirements.
